text:
It would be very nice if the contain-selector could support a regular 
expression for selecting. As I understand from the documentation this is not 
the case:

Example:
I want to select all classes which are not deprecated but which can have a 
deprecated method. This could be expressed with an regep.
creator: t.schoellhorn@wissenswerk.com

text:
Selectors are extensible in that you can write your own and plug it in.  You may
have already known this, but stating so just in case you didn't.
creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com

text: There is a containsregexp selector since nightly build 2003-04-14.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
hauser@acm.org
text:
when will this documented in the above URL?

see for a similar issue: http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23760

As soon as Ant 1.6 has a final release.  It already is documented here
http://ant.apache.org/manual-1.6beta/CoreTypes/selectors.html

If you look at the cover page of the manual your URL refers to, it says that this
is the manual for Ant 1.5.4 which doesn't include the selector.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
